Team — NOVA Infrastructure About Investments Team News Contact Investor Portal ➔ About Investments Team News Contact Catalyzing Value Creation In Infrastructure Investor Portal ➔ Scroll Team Chris Beall Founder & Managing Partner Chris Beall is a Founder and the Managing Partner of NOVA. Chris is an experienced infrastructure investor with 26 years of experience in private equity, investment banking, infrastructure operations, and engineering. He serves as Chair of NOVA’s Investment Committee and on the Executive and Valuation Committees. Currently, Chris serves on the Boards of Directors for the Fund I/II’s portfolio companies Integrated Waste Solutions Group, Nopetro Energy Holdings, and UGE. Since 2017, Chris has built NOVA with Allison Kingsley, forming the NOVA Team and leading the execution of infrastructure investments in NOVA’s Target Sectors. From 2014 to 2017, Chris served as a Managing Director and Co-Portfolio Manager for the Oaktree Capital Group LLC (Oaktree) Infrastructure Investing strategy, acquired by Oaktree from Highstar Capital L.P. (Highstar) in 2014. Prior to Oaktree’s acquisition, he was one of four owners and a Partner of Highstar, the manager of a fourth-generation infrastructure fund responsible for a more than $6.3 billion portfolio of infrastructure investments. Prior to joining Highstar in 2004, Chris was CFO of the Aslan Group, an environmental services and communications firm. From 2000 to 2003, he also worked as an Investment Banking Associate in the Global Natural Resources Group at Lehman Brothers, Inc. Prior to business school, Chris worked in operations and engineering at Koch Gateway Pipeline Company and Koch Refining Company. From 2013 through 2022, Chris was appointed to and served on the Board of Directors of the National Passenger Rail Corporation (Amtrak), the largest provider of passenger rail service in the U.S. Chris earned an M.B.A. from Harvard Business School and a B.S. in Mechanical Engineering from Oklahoma State University. Allison Kingsley Founder & Partner Allison Kingsley is a Founder of NOVA and a Partner. Allison is an experienced infrastructure investor with 24 years of professional experience, including work in infrastructure investing, investment banking, and global strategy and risk. She serves on NOVA’s Investment, Valuation, and Executive Committees.  Currently, Allison serves on the Boards of Directors for Fund I/II’s portfolio companies Bold Ocean (realized), Harbor Logistics, A&R Bulk-Pak, and DartPoints. Since 2017, Allison has built NOVA with Chris Beall, forming the NOVA Team and leading the execution of infrastructure investments in NOVA’s Target Sectors. From 2010 to 2017, Allison was a full-time business school professor and advised on investments and corporate strategy as an independent consultant. From 2006 to 2010, Allison worked as a Director for Reformation, a firm sponsored by PartnerRe for the purposes of investing in global infrastructure, and also invested in direct investments for PartnerRe’s Principal Finance Group. From 2003 to 2006, Allison worked at the public financial guarantor Ambac where she was Vice President in the Emerging Markets Group and formerly Assistant Vice President in the Public & Project Finance Group focusing on North America. At the beginning of her career, she worked at Lehman Brothers as an Investment Banking Associate in the M&A and Power Groups. In addition, as a political economist and former tenured business professor, Allison has published research on infrastructure investing and, from 2003 to 2017, taught business, strategy, political economy, and risk courses at the University of Vermont, Yale University, and New York University. Currently, she serves on the Board of Directors for YWCA Greenwich (CT) and Phillips Infrastructure Holdings. Allison earned a Ph.D. in political economy from Columbia University, an M.S.L. from Yale Law School, and a B.A. with honors from Rice University. Donna Toth Partner & Chief Financial Officer Donna Toth is a Partner and the Chief Financial Officer of NOVA. Donna has 32 years of experience overseeing the financial, operating, and administrative functions of various global advisory and private equity businesses. Donna serves as Chair of the Valuation Committee and on the Investment and Executive Committees. Prior to joining NOVA in 2018, Donna was the CFO at Strata Energy, a middle-market energy infrastructure investment firm. From 2011 to 2013, she served as COO of Alternative Investment Management, a hedge fund and private equity fund of funds, managing all of the firm’s non-investment management functions. From 2005 to 2011, Donna was the CFO and one of six founding partners of Park Hill Group (Park Hill). During a period of rapid growth and expansion, she built and oversaw the organization’s operational infrastructure and was responsible for its integration upon the acquisition by Blackstone in 2007. Prior to Park Hill, from 1999 to 2004, Donna was CFO of Atlantic-Pacific Capital. From 1996 to 1999, she worked at Ziff Brothers Investments after beginning her career as an audit and tax associate at Price Waterhouse. Donna is a CPA and holds a B.S. in Business Administration from the University of Connecticut. Michael Gruppuso COO & CCO Michael Gruppuso is the Chief Operating Officer and the Chief Compliance Officer of NOVA. Michael is an experienced executive with over 41 years of experience leading the operations, compliance, finance and administrative functions of both financial services organizations and financial sponsored portfolio companies. Michael serves as Chair of Nova’s Executive Committee and is a member of the Valuation Committee. Prior to joining Nova in 2024, Michael was CFO and CCO of Rothschild and Co’s. US Corporate Private Equity strategy (Five Arrows Capital Partners) in New York. Michael was a Managing Director and Strategy CFO with the Oaktree Capital LP Infrastructure Investing team from 2012 to 2017. Prior to joining Oaktree, which acquired Highstar Capital LP in 2014, Michael served as CFO for two of Highstar Capital’s portfolio companies. He started his career at Ernst & Young. Michael holds a B.S. from New York University (1983). John Livingston Partner, Sales and Marketing John Livingston is a Partner and responsible for the sales and marketing efforts of NOVA. John is an experienced sales and marketing executive with 33 years of experience in institutional markets. Since 1999, he has participated in numerous fundraisers and has raised capital in various asset classes, including private equity, private debt, private real estate, infrastructure equity, and infrastructure debt. Mr. Livingston sits on NOVA’s Executive Committee. Prior to joining NOVA in 2018, John served as Partner at Pinnacle Trust Partners, where he led the infrastructure sales effort. Prior to joining Pinnacle in 2013, John spent 13 years with American International Group (AIG), and then as a Managing Director at PineBridge Investments, after its acquisition of AIG’s third-party investment business. Prior to AIG, he worked at TCW Group and as a bond trader at Rittenhouse Capital Management and at Insurance Advisory Services. John earned a B.S. from Widener University and previously served in the United States Air Force (1993). Erik Ludtke Operating Partner Erik Ludtke is an Operating Partner of NOVA. Erik has 38 years of experience in the global energy industry serving in various executive roles in business development and operations in which he identified potential acquisitions, integrated operations, and fully commercialized business assets. Erik serves on NOVA’s Investment and Executive Committees. Currently, Erik serves on the Boards of Directors for Fund I’s portfolio companies Hawthorne Aviation and Nopetro Renewables. Prior to joining NOVA in 2019, Erik was the Chief Commercial Officer at NextDecade, a liquified natural gas development company based in Houston, Texas. Prior to NextDecade, from 2015 to 2018, Erik was a Senior Vice President of Commercial and Business Development at Northstar Midstream, a portfolio company of Highstar Capital Fund IV, L.P., where he was responsible for the commercialization of existing assets and development of new midstream business opportunities. He also previously served as Chief Operating Officer at Kiewit Midstream and as Vice President of Gas Marketing and Transportation, Americas at Talisman Energy. Earlier in his career, Erik worked at Peabody Energy and Apache, and also served in various in-country executive roles in Argentina, Israel, India and London with BG Group, Duke Energy and Enron. Erik holds a B.S. in Economics from Texas A&M University and certificates from Wharton School of Business Executive Development Program and International Development Program in Kyoto, Japan. Stephen Denis Managing Director Stephen Denis is a Managing Director at NOVA and has 12 years of experience in infrastructure-focused private equity, project development, and investment banking. He currently serves on the Boards of Directors of Fund I/II’s portfolio companies telMAX, Skywire Networks, and DartPoints. Prior to NOVA, Stephen was the Vice President of Finance at Spire Holdco, a private equity-backed midstream operator developing a large hydrocarbon liquids export terminal project in Western Canada. Stephen was also a Vice President at Strata Energy, a middle-market energy infrastructure investment firm. Prior to Strata, Stephen was a Private Equity Analyst at TPH Partners and an Investment Banking Analyst at Tudor, Pickering, Holt & Co. Stephen holds a B.S.M. in Finance and Legal Studies in Business from Tulane University with honors. Philip Moor Managing Director Philip Moor is a Managing Director at NOVA and has 16 years of experience in the development and financing of power and infrastructure investments. He currently serves on the Boards of Directors of Fund I/II’s portfolio companies Integrated Waste Solutions Group, Hawthorne Aviation, and UGE. Prior to NOVA, Philip worked in the Power & Infrastructure Finance - North America Group at Investec USA Holdings Corp. Before Investec, he was an Associate at eleQtra / InfraCo, Inc., an infrastructure development firm specializing in international greenfield energy and transportation projects. Earlier, Philip worked as a Registered Client Service Associate at UBS Financial Services, Inc. He also worked as a Financial Consultant in São Paulo for Mining Ventures Brasil, a Denham Capital portfolio company. Philip holds a B.A. in Economics from New York University and is a CFA® Charterholder. Faisal Choudhury Senior Vice President Faisal Choudhury is a Senior Vice President at NOVA and has more than 14 years of experience as an investor and investment banker across the infrastructure, energy, and industrial sectors. He currently serves on the Boards of Directors of Fund I’s portfolio companies Harbor Logistics, Nopetro Renewables, and A&R Bulk-Pak. Prior to NOVA, Faisal was a Principal at Glenfarne Group, a developer, owner, operator, and industrial manager of energy and infrastructure assets. He also worked as an Investment Analyst at the International Finance Corporation in Istanbul and as an Associate at Macquarie Capital in New York. Faisal holds an M.B.A. from The Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania and a B.A. from Northwestern University. Bryant Dang Senior Vice President Bryant Dang is a Senior Vice President at NOVA and has 9 years of experience in private equity and investment banking in the infrastructure and energy sectors. He currently serves on the Boards of Directors of Fund I’s portfolio companies Integrated Waste Solutions Group, Harbor Logistics, and A&R Bulk-Pak; he previously served on the Board of Bold Ocean (realized). Prior to joining NOVA, Bryant was an Associate at EIV Capital, a middle market energy-focused private equity firm, where he was responsible for evaluating investment opportunities in the midstream, downstream, oilfield services, and renewable energy sectors in addition to ongoing portfolio management activities. Prior to EIV Capital, Bryant was an Investment Banking Analyst at Moelis & Company where he worked on M&A, recapitalizations and restructuring transactions in the energy sector. Bryant holds a B.B.A. in Finance from the Mays Business School at Texas A&M University. Matthew Altman Vice President Matthew Altman is a Vice President at NOVA and has more than 10 years of infrastructure and energy experience in project development, investment banking and credit and private equity investing. Prior to joining NOVA, Matthew was a Senior Associate at Basalt Infrastructure Partners, a mid-market private equity investor and owner of infrastructure assets. Before Basalt, Matthew was an Associate at Apollo Global Management focusing on private and public investments across power and infrastructure. Earlier, he was an investment banker at BMO Capital Markets and a credit analyst at Fitch Ratings. Matthew holds a B.A. in Economics from Drew University. Noah Frick Vice President Noah Frick is a Vice President at NOVA Infrastructure and has 7 years of experience in investment management, management consulting, and military and intelligence operations. He sits as an Observer to the Boards of Directors of Fund I/II’s portfolio companies Hawthorne Aviation, telMAX, and DartPoints; he previously served as an Observer to the Board of Bold Ocean (realized). Prior to joining NOVA, Noah was an Investment Fellow at Mobility Capital, a transportation-focused investment manager, and a Summer Associate at McKinsey & Co, where he worked on projects covering the aerospace and electric mobility sectors. For five years prior to business school, Noah served as an Intelligence Officer in the U.S. Army, including as a member of the 75th Ranger Regiment, Special Operations Command, where he operated in various capacities including as the Regiment’s designated liaison in Washington D.C. and as a Task Force Intelligence Chief leading a team of analysts focused on sourcing, processing, and operationalizing signals, cyber, human, and geo-spatial intelligence in an overseas combat zone. Noah holds an M.B.A. from the Stanford University Graduate School of Business and an B.S. in Mechanical Engineering and Applied Mechanics from the University of Pennsylvania. Michael Troy Vice President Michael Troy is a Vice President at NOVA and has 7 years of experience in investment banking and corporate finance. Michael currently serves on the Board of Directors of Fund I’s portfolio company Skywire Networks, and as an Observer to the Board of Directors for A&R Bulk-Pak and UGE. Prior to joining NOVA, Michael was an Analyst at Lincoln International, a middle market investment bank, where he was responsible for independent third-party valuations for private equity clients across all industries. Prior to Lincoln International, Michael was a financial analyst in the Scenario Planning and Stress Testing group at AIG. Michael holds an M.B.A. from Anderson School of Management at the University of California, Los Angeles, and an B.S. in Mathematical Business from Wake Forest University. Jeremy Feinstein Senior Associate Jeremy Feinstein is a Senior Associate at NOVA and has 6 years of experience in investment banking and corporate finance. Jeremy sits as an Observer to the Board of Directors of Fund I’s portfolio companies Harbor Logistics and Nopetro Renewables. Prior to joining NOVA, Jeremy was an Associate in the Global Industrials Group at Deutsche Bank, a global investment bank where he advised on over $15 billion of announced M&A transactions and facilitated corporate financings across the transportation, logistics and industrials sectors. Prior to Deutsche Bank, Jeremy was an Analyst in the Industrials Group at Santander and a Summer Analyst at Citigroup. Jeremy holds a B.S. in Accounting and Finance from the School of Management at the University at Buffalo, graduating with honors. David Fuqua Associate David Fuqua is an Associate at NOVA and has nine years of experience across private equity-backed companies and investment banking. Prior to joining NOVA, David was Director of Finance at Integrated Waste Solutions Group (IWSG). He played a key role in the sale of IWSG’s Austin-area assets. Earlier in his career, David was an Investment Banking Associate at Deloitte Corporate Finance and has held director-level finance roles at other private equity-backed businesses. David began his career as an Infantry Officer in the United States Marine Corps. He holds an M.B.A. from The University of Texas at Austin and a B.A. from The Citadel. Andrew Parsons Director of Finance and Operations Andrew Parsons is the Director of Finance and Operations at NOVA and has 10 years of experience in accounting, operations, and compliance, predominantly in the alternative investment management industry. Prior to joining NOVA, Andrew was the Deputy CFO and Business Manager of White Marigold Capital Management, a hedge fund manager. Andrew helped launch the fund, designing and implementing the financial and back-office operations, managing third party service providers, and sitting on the Valuation and Risk Management committees. Before White Marigold, Andrew was an execution trader for the volatility arbitrage desk at BlueCrest Capital Management. Andrew earned his M.B.A. with a concentration in Finance from Tulane University, graduating with honors. He also holds a B.A. in Economics from Tulane University. Liz Miller Accounting and Operations Associate Liz Miller is an Accounting and Operations Associate at NOVA with over 9 years supporting executives in various industries. Prior to joining NOVA, Liz worked as an Administrative Assistant to the managing members at Aesir Capital Management, a hedge fund in Greenwich, CT. Previously she worked both in the C-suite at Cantor Fitzgerald and in medical private practices. Liz holds a B.S. in Accounting from the School of Business and Economics at Lehigh University and an M.S. in Finance from I.E. International Business School in Madrid, Spain. Patrick Tanella Executive Assistant Patrick Tanella is an Executive Assistant at NOVA and has 5 years of experience in administrative roles. He has supported executives in various industries, including finance, healthcare, art, and fashion. Prior to joining NOVA, Patrick acted as the Executive Assistant for the compliance team at Moore Capital Management in New York City. Previously, he worked as the Operations Assistant at East Rock Capital. Patrick holds a B.A. in Psychology from Vassar College (2015) and an M.A. in History and Philosophy of Art from the University of Kent’s Paris School of Arts and Culture (2022). Senior Advisors Charles Appleby Senior Advisor – Environmental Services Charlie Appleby is a highly experienced operator with more than 46 years of experience in executive leadership, corporate finance and accounting, waste management, and private equity. Previously, Charles was a founder, CEO and Chairman of Advanced Disposal Services (ADS), where he built the company from a small start-up operation to the 4th largest waste management company in the United States. Charles founded Integrated Waste Solutions Group (IWSG) with Managing Partner Chris Beall and currently serves as IWSG’s Executive Chairman. IWSG was formed in 2017 to pursue a vertically integrated geographic hub strategy in the waste management sector. Dion Nicely Senior Advisor – Transportation & Energy / Energy Transition Dion Nicely is an accomplished and entrepreneurial leader in finance, operations and logistics who has nearly 22 years of combined experience in the US Coast Guard and the private sector. Dion is the Founder and President of Veterans Maritime, a maritime logistics and advisory company that transports government freight and energy products. Veterans Maritime also invests in and owns Jones Act compliant vessels under partnership with Military Sealift Command. Previously, Dion served as director of logistics and transportation for Bridger Logistics. He spent more than 12 years as an active duty officer in the US Coast Guard, serving on four vessels, including one tour as Commanding Officer of a Patrol Boat in support of Operation Iraqi Freedom. Dion currently serves as CEO and is on the Board of Directors of Bold Ocean, a US Flag maritime logistics business serving the US government. Martin Rees Senior Advisor – Energy / Energy Transition Martin Rees is a highly experienced finance executive with over 47 years of experience in project and corporate finance, treasury, accounting, business development, and mergers & acquisitions. In his focus on the global energy sector, Martin has structured and closed more than $10 billion in energy project, corporate, and acquisition financings. Previously, Martin worked as the CFO of InterGen N.V. (Intergen) where he had full financial responsibility for a 6,000 MW contracted and merchant power portfolio operating in six countries. Prior to Intergen, Martin held various finance and business development roles at both Reliant Energy and Westinghouse Electric. Martin currently serves on the Board of Directors of Nopetro Renewables and UGE. Kevin Shuba Senior Advisor – Transportation Kevin Shuba is an experienced operator with more than 40 years of experience in executive leadership, operations and business development, and private equity in the transportation and logistics sector. Kevin currently serves as the CEO of Harbor Logistics and A&R Bulk-Pak. Previously, Kevin served as the CEO of OmniTRAX Inc., one of North America’s largest private railroad holding companies, for eight years. Prior to joining OmniTRAX and The Broe Group, Kevin had a sixteen-year career with Brambles Limited, the six-billion-dollar logistics services company, where he oversaw Chep’s US and Americas operations. Kevin held several senior sales and management positions with Baxter Healthcare Corporation over a ten-year period. In addition to his significant operating experience, Kevin has also served as a Member of the Board of Directors for multiple private equity-backed logistics companies that span various sectors in the transportation space. Kevin also served in the United States Army for six years and is a graduate of the United States Military Academy at West Point. Kevin currently serves as CEO and on the Board of Directors of Harbor Logistics and A&R Bulk-Pak. Stephen Smith Senior Advisor – Energy Transition and Environmental Services Stephen Smith is a highly accomplished industry leader and expert with more than 45 years of experience in solid waste management, landfill construction, landfill gas recovery and energy system construction, environmental engineering, and compliance and safety training. Previously, Stephen served as a senior vice president at Aria Energy, where he was responsible for project development of numerous RNG facilities. Prior to Aria, Mr. Smith held senior-level positions at Clean Energy Renewable Fuels, Atwell LLC, Hydro Geo Chem, Inc., SCS Engineers, and Waste Management, Inc. In these positions he was responsible for developing, planning, designing and implementing programs both in the solid waste and hazardous waste fields. Stephen has served on the Board of Governors of the National Waste & Recycling Association since 1995, is an author of over 20 papers and presentations in technically reviewed journals, trade magazines and conference proceedings, and has served on several gubernatorial appointed and other committees within the states of Arizona, Colorado, and Utah to investigate solid and hazardous waste issues. John Troy Senior Advisor – Digital & General Infrastructure John Troy is a veteran infrastructure investor with more than 39 years of private equity and corporate Board leadership experience. Most recently, John served as a Senior Advisor to Prostar Capital, a $500 million energy infrastructure private equity firm that he co-founded in 2012 and retired from in 2017.  Prior to Prostar Capital, John served as Managing Director of TVG Capital Partners, a $700 million Asian telecom focused infrastructure private equity firm that he founded in 1998, and as a founding member of The Asian Infrastructure Fund, a $750 million investment vehicle sponsored by the International Finance Corporation, Asian Development Bank, and George Soros. John currently serves as Chairman on the Board of Directors of telMAX, a fiber and telecom services platform. He also serves on the Board of Pacific Telecom, an Asian-based telecom infrastructure owner and operator. Senior Advisors are available to provide advice and industry knowledge at the request of NOVA, although such persons are not employees of NOVA. Unveiling NOVA 535: The Perfect Setting for Your Unforgettable Celebration - NOVA 535 Skip to content NOVA 535 Best Rated Wedding Venue in Tampa St. Pete Galleries Pricing Get Started Public Events Venue FAQ Contact Search Search… NOVA 535 Best Rated Wedding Venue in Tampa St. Pete Close menu Galleries Pricing Get Started Public Events Venue FAQ Contact NOVA 535 Best Rated Wedding Venue in Tampa St. Pete Search Toggle menu Search… Unveiling NOVA 535: The Perfect Setting for Your Unforgettable Celebration By Michael Novilla July 23, 2023 July 23, 2023 News Stepping into NOVA 535, you find yourself immersed in a world where historic charm and modern elegance intertwine seamlessly, providing the perfect backdrop for any occasion. Be it your dream wedding, a festive holiday party, or a social gathering that’s the talk of the town. Located in the heart of downtown St. Petersburg, Florida, NOVA 535 stands as a testament to the beauty of fusing the past with the present. Built in 1920 and lovingly transformed into a world-class venue, NOVA 535 offers guests an unparalleled event experience. Your Dream Wedding at NOVA 535 Imagine saying ‘I do’ in a historic yet modernized venue, rich with character and style. NOVA 535 is not your average wedding venue; we embrace your unique vision, ensuring your big day is not just special but uniquely yours. Our 5-star venue offers a hassle-free, boundless wedding experience. From our professional caterers who will tantalize your tastebuds, to our full liquor bar that offers all beverage preferences, we’ve got all your bases covered. Celebratory Holiday Parties When it comes to holiday parties, there’s nothing like a distinctive, character-rich venue to set the right tone. The timeless charm of NOVA 535 coupled with its modern amenities, creates an environment ripe for celebration. The space is versatile enough to accommodate themed decorations and offers an air of exclusivity, as we host only one event at a time, yours! Your holiday party wouldn’t just be another event on the calendar, but an unforgettable celebration etched in the memories of your guests. Social Events that Sparkle Whether it’s a charity gala, a corporate event, or a birthday bash, social events at NOVA 535 come alive in a whole new light. The unique ambience of the venue, committed staff, and top-notch amenities set the stage for an event that resonates with your style and purpose. Moreover, the downtown St. Pete location adds an extra touch of allure, making it easy for local and out-of-town guests to attend. Trusted Since 2008 Since opening our doors in February 2008, NOVA 535 has been on a mission to captivate and enchant our guests with exceptional experiences. Our commitment to hosting one event at a time ensures that your event gets the attention it deserves. This dedication to service excellence has seen countless clients trust us with their special moments, and had generated over 1,000 5-star online reviews! Choosing NOVA 535 is choosing a unique, stress-free experience in a locally owned venue that mixes the best of historical allure and modern elegance. When you choose NOVA 535, you’re not just booking an event venue; you’re crafting warm memories destined to last a lifetime. Because at NOVA 535, we believe that every event should be as unique and unforgettable as the person hosting it. If you’re seeking a venue that’s truly out of the ordinary, look no further than NOVA 535 – where every celebration becomes a memorable masterpiece. Visit NOVA 535 , text us at 727-758-7657 , or email Sales@NOVA535.com so we can get started helping you plan your next epic event. The original 1920 clay brick walls have been preserved and now surround a Brazilian wood dance floor ready to welcome your guests. The private courtyard makes a lovely ceremony spot. A thicket of lush, dramatically lit 30-foot-tall bamboo surrounds the area, and twinkling café lights span the patio. And before you exchange vows, the wedding parties can prepare in the VIP lounge and additional "get ready suite." Top-of-the-line audiovisual and lighting services offer nightclub quality sound, adaptable color washes allow you to create a customizable ambiance, and a video/slideshow system is perfect for projecting your fave photos or home movies. FAQ - NOVA 535 Skip to content NOVA 535 Best Rated Wedding Venue in Tampa St. Pete Galleries Pricing Get Started Public Events Venue FAQ Contact Search Search… NOVA 535 Best Rated Wedding Venue in Tampa St. Pete Close menu Galleries Pricing Get Started Public Events Venue FAQ Contact NOVA 535 Best Rated Wedding Venue in Tampa St. Pete Search Toggle menu Search… FAQ Frequently Asked Questions Pick a topic or search: Does NOVA 535 offer a Preferred Vendors List? Yes, our Preferred Vendors list, which we refer to as our 5-Star Vendors , is available to our booked clients. What are the parking options and directions to NOVA 535? Parking and Directions to NOVA 535 Unique Event Space , located at 535 Dr. M. L. King Jr. Street North, St. Petersburg, Florida 33701. NOVA 535 on Google Maps . What upgrades extras and add-ons are available at NOVA 535? Check our NOVA 535 Inventory. What is required to secure my date? 3 Steps to Booking NOVA 535, (1) Please review our pricing menu , (2) enter your event info , then you are (3) prompted to Schedule your tour . Also, Sales@nova535.com is always available to assist you personally. When can I schedule my wedding rehearsal? Your Wedding Rehearsal is scheduled at the 30-day mark after all updates, final headcount, and payment in full have been received. Subject to venue availability. Can I rent just the courtyard? When you rent NOVA 535 the entire venue is yours. The price is the same no matter how much of NOVA you use. Can I swap out beverages in my drink package? No substitution of beverages on drink packages. Any beverage legally available to NOVA 535 (as a Florida Liquor License holder) can be ordered and added to your invoice and bar service. All beverages must come from NOVA 535. Can I bring in my own linens? All your event linens are rented through NOVA 535. When was NOVA 535 built? The 535 9th street north building was built in 1920 as “Slap Happy’s” 5-and-dime store. In 2005 the building was being utilized as a doggie daycare called “Pet Planet” when it was purchased by NOVA 535 founder Michael Scott Novilla. 3 years and $3MM later, 535 was transformed into NOVA 535 Unique Event Space, opening to the public on February 9, 2008. What is a GOBO? A “Gobo” is a small stenciled circular disc, usually made of steel, and used in lighting fixtures to create a projected image or pattern. The term Gobo is short for “Go Between Optics”, describing the location where it needs to be positioned in the light path of a lighting fixture. Check our inventory . What is the Seating Capacity of NOVA 535? INSIDE: DOWNSTAIRS is 220 seated with dance floor, 260 seated for dining, 300 seated for ceremonies, 35 0 standing for cocktail parties. UPSTAIRS is 80 seated for dining or 125 standing for cocktail parties. INSIDE TOTAL: is 340 seated for dining, 380 seated for ceremonies, 475 standing for cocktail parties. Our OUTDOOR COURTYARD adds 150 seated for dining, 250 seated for ceremonies, 300 standing for cocktail parties, giving a TOTAL VENUE CAPACITY of 490 seated for dining or 775 standing for cocktails. How does Catering Work? We’ve curated a list of the area’s best caterer s and food trucks. They offer all types of food, accommodate any special dietary needs, will fit your budget, and serve it to your guests any way you desire. Can I bring in outside beverages? No. All beverages must be provided by NOVA 535. What does the Venue Manager do? (1) Updating your MyNOVAEvent Event Schedule Include your floorplan, timeline, vendor list, invoice, and other event details located inside MyNOVAEvent.com (2) Scheduling and Coordinating your Rehearsal Your NOVA wedding rehearsal is set at the 30-day mark once all final details, final headcount, and payment in full have been received. Based on venue availability. (3) Vendor Confirmation Email Sent from our system to confirm vendor arrival and departure times as well as provide vendors with helpful event information and links. (4) Day-of Decor Set up Place decor including cake cutting utensils, toasting glasses, bar signage, seating chart (does not include individual escort cards), and memory table items. All other assembled decor items must be agreed to in writing and may incur an additional fee. All items must come fully assembled and placement-ready. (5) Day-of Coordination Includes timeline management, coordination of ceremony Line-up, on-site vendor communication, and facilitation of all NOVA 535 related tasks. What is the History of NOVA 535? The 535 9th street north building was built in 1920 as “Slap Happy’s” 5-and-dime store. In 2005 the building was being utilized as a doggie daycare called “Pet Planet” when it was purchased by NOVA 535 founder Michael Scott Novilla. 3 years and $3MM later, 535 was transformed into NOVA 535 Unique Event Space, opening to the public on February 9, 2008. What does the AV Systems and Tech include? The NOVA 535 AV Lighting Systems and Tech include; use of NOVA AV SYSTEMS, (Microphone, Sound, Lighting, and HD Video systems), Set up, and Operation of AV Systems during your event.  Covers Music Royalty Fees. Band/Musician/DJ must Complete a walk-thru meeting at NOVA at least 7 days before the event, Provide 100% of the equipment needed to perform, and Plug band audio out into NOVA PA via XLR. Does NOVA 535 allow Food Trucks? Yes! We’ve curated a list of the area’s best caterers and food trucks. They offer all types of food, accommodate any special dietary needs, will fit your budget, and serve it to your guests any way you desire. Up to 3 food trucks fit inside our private, brick and bamboo courtyard. Is NOVA 535 Dog and Pet Friendly? Yes, we love pets at NOVA 535. Yes, you can have your pets (dogs, cats, etc.) at your wedding. Private events can be dog and pet-friendly if the host (NOVA’s client) is ok with that. Events open to the public depend on the event type and theme. A late-night DJ dance party would not be good to bring your pet to, but a pet-themed event would be fine. Is NOVA 535 LGBT Friendly? YES!! When is our final payment due? Final headcount along with your final payment is due 30 days prior to your event. Novilla It was a pleasure meeting and working with the delightful Ashlea and (then) soon to be hubby James! They were looking for a unique wedding venue, not another beach hotel nor ballroom feel, and luckily for us all they found our historic venue NOVA 535. My team really handled most all of their planning and day of details for their outdoor downtown St. Petersburg wedding here at my venue NOVA 535, and I’m delighted that everything went fabulously! James and Ashlea are such a lovely couple, so cute and in love, that it gives single people hope that Mr/Mrs Right is out there just awaiting that right lucky moment of chance and meeting. Congrats!! Pink and White Outdoor Downtown St. Petersburg Wedding When searching for a unique St. Petersburg wedding venue , Ashlea and James were adamant in having the culture and liveliness of St. Petersburg. They soon realized that NOVA 535 would be the perfect location to host their nuptials and encompassed everything they could have dreamed of in a wedding venue. Their sophisticated and traditional wedding at NOVA 535 fit the couple’s style, and the atmosphere of the venue helped enhance the atmosphere of their big day. “I was looking for something different, not your typical venue or your typical Florida wedding,” Ashlea shared. “I chose NOVA 535 because there aren’t a lot of venues like it in our area. I loved the NYC loft style building with exposed brick and wood beams.” The Brandon couple opted for an outdoor, St. Pete wedding ceremony under a wedding altar draped in flowers and flowing fabric. Guests watched the couple say their nuptials in the beautiful Florida weather. Ashlea and James’ indoor reception was intimate and full of pink uplighting that enhanced the mood of the room. Tables were decorated with lighted trees with hanging crystals and candlelight accents that added to the romanticism of the decor. What did you look for in a wedding venue: I was looking for something different, not your typical venue or your typical Florida wedding. I chose NOVA 535 because there aren’t a lot of venues like it in our area.  I loved the NYC loft style building with exposed brick and wood beams. As far as service, I felt it could not have been better. Ruby, our coordinator, was truly amazing, and the staff was perfection. They were quick, efficient, friendly and professional. Novaween 13 Costumes and Contests - NOVA 535 Skip to content NOVA 535 Best Rated Wedding Venue in Tampa St. Pete Galleries Pricing Get Started Public Events Venue FAQ Contact Search Search… NOVA 535 Best Rated Wedding Venue in Tampa St. Pete Close menu Galleries Pricing Get Started Public Events Venue FAQ Contact NOVA 535 Best Rated Wedding Venue in Tampa St. Pete Search Toggle menu Search… Novaween 13 Costumes and Contests By Michael Novilla November 13, 2019 November 14, 2019 News Novaween 13 Costumes and Contests at historic DTSP venue NOVA 535, in beautiful downtown St. Pete, Florida. October 31, 2019, a humid Thursday Halloween Night in St. Petersburg, Florida, welcomed our annual Halloween Costume Party, Novaween. Of course held here at our historic DTSP venue NOVA 535 in beautiful Downtown St. Pete. DTSP as we locals call it. This year we celebrated Novaween 13, St. Pete’s Favorite Adults Only, wild and crazy, Halloween Costume Party! Novaween originated years before NOVA 535 opened in 2008, a carry forward of our Halloween house parties. The 1st “official” Novaween was held here at NOVA 535 on October 31, 2007, even before we opened for business. Literally under construction. Below are fans, friends and vendors who all help, thank you, to make Novaween so fabulous; including those fellow visionary Entrepreneurs like Chill Lounge founder Rainer Sheer and his amazing wife and designer Patty Filameno All eyes (below) are on the dazzling aeriast star Riquette Ramsey ! Riquette (green wig) joins a very scary MacClown and fellow performer, Gogo dancer Carmen Lai Garden Speaking on incredibly talented, beautiful and amazing entertainers, the lucky (and talented himself) Mr. Aaron Bond is surrounded by rising star entertainer Gaby Rosa (on our left) and the bedazzling aerialist Taylor Roberts. Taylor and Gaby provided us all with an incredible show tonight via their Underground Cirque troupe, Bravo! Aerialist Taylor Roberts below…. she was definitely NOT ducking-around all night, unlike this “bird”… Taylor Roberts with James Dukes, aka James on Chains , wow! Our favorite everything superwoman, fire goddess, hostess, aerialist, dancer, burlesque performer, actor and more, the sizzling hot Mayven Missbehavin ! Also props to our DJ JB Nicotera , food truck by Vanchetta , Tarot Card by Ani Crane, Stage and AV Consultation by Chuck Taylor at Production Source , plus up close magic by Mr Amazing Cory Van Valin ! Cory even made our costume contest winning couple turn invisible! A special thanks to the lovely Michelle LaRose , assistant to our fabulous Dr. Paul Bearer , plus in purple our most wonderful TV hostess, producer, actor, Entrepreneur and almost everything else, Nancy Alexander. Below is my friend and 99.5% likely yours too, the Pope of St. Pete Florida, the (mostly) Honorable Jon “Reno” Labudde keeping “good” company! Hold tight for the videos… here is the other Novaween 13 blog, https://nova535.com/step-into-novaween-13/ thanks! Below are all Novaween 13 Costumes and Contests Photos from Barry Lively Images . Check our next blog for the wild and crazy videos coming too! As always THANK YOU ALL for your love and support! Don’t be upset that Novaween has passed this year – that doesn’t mean that your fun has stopped! Book your own stress-free Holiday Party, Wedding or Corporate Event here at our 5-Star venue NOVA 535!
